intro: Guarea williamsii, commonly known as the blackwood tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a dense canopy. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive shape with a heart-shaped base. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal.
